faqItems.a: SayLog is a voice-based diary service that converts your speech to text and records your daily life and emotions.

faqItems.q: How do I record a diary?
faqItems.a: Tap the record button and speak. Your voice will be converted to text and saved automatically.
AI analyzes your speech to identify primary and secondary emotions. This is for reference only and does not provide medical or professional diagnosis.

faqItems.q: Can I edit AI analysis results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can tap the emotion icon to change it. AI analysis is for reference, and the final judgment is yours.
Yes, you can delete records. Deleted records are retained for a period before being permanently removed.
Your voice and text data are securely stored following privacy principles. They are never shared publicly or used for AI training.

faqItems.q: Is it available in multiple languages?
faqItems.a: The app defaults to your system language, and you can change it in settings. Records are saved in the language you speak.
Basic features are free. Some premium features will be available through paid plans in the future.
